question.text: The characteristic/s of a renewable exhaustible natural resource is

options.text: Renewable resources are living, able to reproduce or replace themselves and to get increased in number.
Can be recycled but should not be used beyond a limit.
Every resource is exhaustible, except solar power, wind power, tidal and wave power, and thermal power.

solution.text: Exhaustible resources are the natural resources that are likely to be exhausted due to their continuous use. Forest is renewable exhaustible resource that can be again and again produced. Coal, petroleum and minerals are non-renewable exhaustible natural resources that cannot be produced again.
